revised_title: Vibrational Analysis and Molecular Structure of Urea and Guanidinium
tldr: This article explores the molecular structure and vibrations of urea and guanidinium using quantum mechanical resonance theory. The authors calculate the vibrations and force constants for both molecules, finding that the C-N bond in urea has approximately 28% double-bond character, while the guanidinium ion has complete resonance with each C-N bond having single-bond character. The study provides insights into the electronic structure and bonding of these molecules, which can be useful for understanding their chemical behavior and properties.
